basic.description:
Provides advanced understanding of concepts related to the use of physical activity/lifestyle as a strategy for reducing morbidity and mortality in general and selected special populations in preparation to participate in a variety of multidisciplinary clinical and/or professional health care environments.
NOTE    This course will normally be offered in academic years starting with an odd number (eg., 2013-2014). Students in a KINE Plan will have priority over students in a PHED Plan.
basic.subject: KNPE
basic.title: Advanced Physical Activity and Health

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisites     Level 3 or above in a KINE or PHED Specialization Plan and KNPE 125; KNPE 225; KNPE 227 and KNPE 255.
